name: blanquette
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
a dish that consists of white meat such as fish, chicken, or veal (= meat from a young cow) in a white sauce: The veal meat simmers in white blanquette sauce with mushrooms and onions. For a very reasonable price, guests feast off charcuterie, a blanquette of Bresse chicken, and a selection of local cheeses.
More examplesFewer examplesThe main course was blanquette of veal – just the trim of the meat boiled up in some sauce.The word "blanquette" comes from "blanc", which means "white" in French.Seasonal dishes include scallops with Jerusalem artichokes, veal blanquette, and chocolate mille-feuille with wild raspberries.
